title: Culturally Responsive Computing Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of introductory computer science concepts and foundational cultural diversity knowledge
context.additional_context: Learning to integrate computing education and cultural elements through blended teaching method design. Includes real-case-based project development and evaluation

learning_goals: Using a blended learning design framework, learners create three or more educational module proposals integrating cultural elements (traditions, arts, etc.) and computing elements (algorithms, data visualization, etc.) and demonstrate design proficiency by meeting at least four of five evaluation criteria (e.g., creativity, feasibility) through peer reviews and instructor feedback.

Learners develop two computing education scenarios reflecting at least three cultural backgrounds (e.g., Asia, Africa, Latin America) and submit final versions after validating the scenarios' cultural appropriateness and educational effectiveness through peer reviews and instructor feedback.
Develop the ability to perform an educational material improvement process through feedback incorporation
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
